Spot.IM FAQ

Home/

How do I create a Spot?
+-

Great to have you join the Spot.IM family!
In order to create a Spot, you need to go to www.spot.im and click on the Get Spot.IM now button.

  1. Sign in to Spot.IM via your preferred social network to create a user profile
  2. Choose your Spot’s name and design it according to the branding of your website. With a logo and color to match, a category that best describes your Spot and so on.

Once you’ve created a Spot you are automatically assigned as the Spot’s host. If you create several Spots, you’re a host in all of them. You can edit your Spot at the Manage Spot page.

How do I create and embed a Spot for WordPress site?
+-

Spot.IM offers you an easy and simple way to create and embed a Spot on your WordPress site:

  1. Install Spot.IM Plugin either via the search option inside WordPress plugins page, or by uploading the files to your server (in the /wp-content/plugins/ directory).
  2. Activate the plugin, and go to the plugin page in Settings > Spot.IM.
  3. Fill in your Spot’s ID and check the Power On checkbox for activating it on your WordPress website.

Now you are set to go!

For more details go to the Spot.IM WordPress plugin page.

Why isn’t my Spot loading?
+-

There could be several possible reasons for a Spot not loading, the most common ones are:

  • A Spot is the last component loaded on any site its on, please check if your site has loaded fully.
  • Maybe you forgetting to embed the code…
  • Or got so excited about your new Spot that you embedded it twice!
  • Or might have embedding it in the footer instead of the body.

If you find that none of these options is relevant to you please contact us at support@spot.im with some details about your website, name of your Spot and a description of the embedding process you went through. We’ll be glad to assist.

How do I load my Spot faster?
+-

We know your community members just can’t wait for your Spot to load and get the conversation going! If you want the Spot to load faster, just move the Spot’s code to a higher place in your site’s HTML code.

If it’s still loading not as fast as you like it, please contact us at support@spot.im. Don’t forget to mention some details about your website and the name of your Spot – we’ll be glad to assist.

How can I edit my Spot?
+-

The Manage Spots page is the place to go if you want to make any changes in your Spot. If your the host of several Spots you can find all of them in this section. Just click on the Manage button next to the Spot you’d like to edit, and choose what you’d like to change:

The General Tab
Lets you edit the Spot’s general information like: Spots name, Spot Category, allowed languages on your Spot and update your embed code if needed. It also shows you your Spots status to make sure your Spot is embedded correctly.

The Design Tab
Enables you to edit all things visual in your Spot: change your Spot photo, the positioning of your Spot in your website’s pages and your brand’s color.

How can I get more users on to my Spot?
+-

The best way to get users to your Spot, is to acknowledge it as an integral part of your site, and getting more involved in operating it.

There are many tips & tricks we can share to help you best utilize your Spot and enlarge your community, Visit our Best Practices page for more information.

How do I moderate the content on my Spot?
+-

Spot.IM offers several moderation tools and options: moderation by community or host and automatic mediation for languages, bad words and unwanted external links.
You can find all the information about our moderation tools here and also contact us at support@spot.im for any help, suggestions and questions.

How do I get the Spot.IM app code?
+-

In order to download and register to the Spot.IM app properly, please start the process from the web version of the Spot (a Spot you host or want to join or any random Spot you’re in). Click the “Continue From Mobile” option under the Sent button, and follow the insurrections to get the code.

Do you have a Joomla plugin?
+-

Not yet. Until we do, you can embed a Spot in the site’s HTML like this tutorial shows: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vQCDEJl3eRk

How do I embed A Spot on Blogger?
+-

This Blogger help page will assist you with the embedding: https://support.google.com/blogger/answer/53220?hl=en.

Will the Spot require resources from our content\community team?
+-

It depends on the website and on amount of user. We strongly recommend you take a look at our Best Practices page to get a better idea about how to best utilize your Spot.

Where can I see a Spot working live to get a better idea of it?
+-

You can see some great Spots live at:
www.kerrang.com
www.redbullcliffdiving.com
www.cgsociety.org
www.suamusica.com.br

How do I change the Spot’s interface language?
+-

Currently the Spot’s interface is partially translates to 16 languages:  English, German, Spanish, French, Hebrew, Hungarian, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Dutch, Portuguese, Romanian, Russian, Turkish,  Ukrainian and Chinese. Soon to be fully translated. The language of the interface is determined by the language of the user’s browser: if a user is using a browser in French, he\she will see the translate interface in French, etc.
